intro: Micromeles hemsleyi, commonly known as the Hemsley's micromeles, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
